greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of odd proper divisors of n. That is, the number of odd divisors of n that are less than n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=2} x^k/(1 - x^(2*k)). - _Seiichi Manyama_, Jan 23 2021
example: The odd divisors of 15 that are less than 15 are 1, 3 and 5. Therefore there are three odd divisors of 15 that are less than 15.
program: (PARI) my(N=66, x='x+O('x^N)); concat(0, Vec(sum(k=2, N, x^k/(1-x^(2*k))))) \\ _Seiichi Manyama_, Jan 23 2021
results.author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Mar 12 2004
ext: Corrected and extended by _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 28 2012
